text: A relic is an object or personal item of religious significance preserved as a tangible memorial. Relic(s) or The Relic may also refer to: ==Film and television== * The Relic (film), a 1997 horror film based on the 1995 novel (see below) * Relic (2020 film), a horror film * Relics: Einstein's Brain, a 1994 documentary * "Relics" (Star Trek: The Next Generation), an episode of Star Trek: The Next Generation * "Relic", an episode of Smallville * "Relic", the nickname of Stafford T. Phillips, a character in the Canadian TV series The Beachcombers *Relic Hunter, Canadian television series (1999 to 2002) starring Tia Carrere ==Gaming== * Relic Entertainment, a Canadian game development company * Relic Online, an online gaming system * Relic (Dungeons & Dragons), a category of magical item * Relic, a collectible item in the video game series Crash Bandicoot * Relic, an objective in the real-time strategy video game Age of Empires II: The Age of Kings ==Other media== * The Relic (novel), a novel by José Maria de Eça de Queirós first published in 1887 * Relic (novel), a 1995 novel by Douglas Preston and Lincoln Child * Relic, a 2001 novel by Tom Egeland * Relic, a 2018 novel by Alan Dean Foster * Relics (album), a 1971 album by Pink Floyd * "The Relic", a song by Symphony X from Twilight in Olympus * Relic (comics), an enemy of Green Lantern * The Relic (video game), a 2011 iOS role-playing game ==See also== *Relict, a surviving remnant of natural phenomena *Residue (disambiguation)
title: Relic (disambiguation)
